abstract: Bank of America was involved in accounting for fourth-quarter write-downs at Merrill Lynch before it acquired the brokerage firm, The Financial Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America was involved in accounting for fourth-quarter write-downs at Merrill Lynch before it acquired the brokerage firm, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: BofA Involved in Merrill Write-Downs, Report Says

abstract: Most of the Merrill bonuses, which included some 700 awards of over $1 million, would not be affected by a new bonus tax being considered in Congress.
snippet: Most of the Merrill bonuses, which included some 700 awards of over $1 million, would not be affected by a new bonus tax being considered in Congress.
lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch’s $3.6 billion bonus pool has been among the most controversial payouts on Wall Street. But most of those bonuses, which included some 700 awards of over $1 million, would not be affected by a new bonus tax being considered in Congress.

headline.main: $2.5 Billion in Merrill Bonuses Would Elude Tax
headline.print_headline: $2.5 Billion in Merrill Bonuses Would Elude Tax

abstract: Americans are traveling to other countries in search of affordable health care. Here’s some advice on how to avoid the pitfalls.
snippet: Americans are traveling to other countries in search of affordable health care. Here’s some advice on how to avoid the pitfalls.
lead_paragraph: WHEN Ben Schreiner, a 62-year-old retired Bank of America executive, found out last year he would need surgery for a double hernia, he started evaluating possible doctors and hospitals. But he didn’t look into the medical center in his hometown, Camden, S.C., or the bigger hospitals in nearby Columbia. Instead, his search led him to consider surgery in such far-flung places as Ireland, Thailand and Turkey.

headline.main: Going Abroad to Find Affordable Health Care
headline.print_headline: Going Abroad to Find Affordable Health Care
